text: when many people think about Africa they
think about poverty especially those of
us from the Western world it's often the
first image that comes to mind it's
certainly what I thought for the first
26 years of my life until I first
stepped foot on the continent a few
years ago and now after visiting 53 of
the 54 countries in Africa I can say
with complete confidence that is home to
the most diverse sites the most
breathtaking views the most beautiful
Souls and the most unbelievable
experiences that you can't find anywhere
else on this earth
[Music]
okay icky Galilee and I just ran into a
bunch of homies Africa is the origin of
mankind home to about 2000 spoken
languages the different cultures here
are astounding
for example South Sudan is home to the
world's tallest tribe called the Dinkas
while the neighboring country of Central
African Republic has the world's
shortest tribe called the pygmies let me
say that once again the world's tallest
humans are living directly across the
border from the world's shortest humans
many African cities like Nairobi Kigali
and Johannesburg are shockingly modern
with all the amenities that you can find
in New York City or London some of the
best nightlife scenes I've witnessed
were on the beaches of Lagos Nigeria and
on the streets of Marrakech Morocco when
it comes to cleanliness Rwanda is
capital of Kigali is as clean if not
cleaner than Singapore the country of
Somalia has some of the most picturesque
beaches I've seen anywhere in this world
the same goes for Tanzania welcome to
Zanzibar
and while we're on the subject of nature
Africa is covered in vast deserts
tropical rainforests beautiful lakes
tall mountains fertile grasslands and
other landscapes that you never even
knew existed my favorite moments in the
wild have been hiking mountaineering
dongho in the DR Congo the lava just
illuminates the sky behind me driving
across the sand dunes of Namibia and
going on a safari in Botswana where I
saw Rhino lion giraffe elephant and
hippo right in front of my eyes Africa
is where I've learned the most about
religion from the muslim-dominated
northern region to the Christian
dominated central and southern parts
don't forget about the traditional
religions like voodooism and West Africa
voodoo
the African religion the first one and
lastly we should appreciate Africa
because it's home to many of the world's
most important inventions like
mathematics the oldest known
mathematical object is the lebombo bone
dating back to 35,000 BC which was
discovered in the mountains of Swaziland
Swaziland like medicines many treatments
that were used today in modern medicine
have been derived from Africa ages ago
the earliest known surgery was performed
in Egypt around 2750 BC like law and
religion the ancient Ethiopians were the
first to honor their gods offer
sacrifices and establish a system of
organized law like speech evidence
suggests that language probably emerged
somewhere in sub-saharan Africa during
the Middle Stone Age hence the first
words ever spoken by humans were from
Africans hello my name is Kalani I just
came back to visit Namco basic ootah
about life yes poverty exists just like
crime and corruption but these three
things exist in every country in the
world including mine and yours the vast
majority of African nations are quickly
improving their economies their politics
and their state of life the past decade
has seen an enormous number of mega
corporations emerging onto the continent
take Luanda Angola for example ten years
ago there was barely any skyline and now
it looks like this moreover six of the
top ten fastest-growing economies in the
world are in Africa with number one
being Ethiopia all in all I find I
forgot to be extremely underrated and it
doesn't get the credit that it
if you've been before then you probably
know what I'm talking about
and if you've yet to go then I urge you
to give it a try there's something
magical this just draws me into Africa
and I know for a fact that I'll always
be going back to see more
